Package gamecore.item

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CombatUsable
    Provides both type and behavior for things usable in combat (items, abilities, etc).
    Item
    Objects implementing this interface are considered representations of physical items.

    Items should be immutable, relying on their containing Inventory and ItemDrop objects to determine changeable attributes such as stack size.

    If the item is to be usable, it should also implement either Usable or CombatUsable.
    ItemType
    Each item has a type.
    PotionType
    Each Potion.class object contains a reference to a PotionType object, which is used to determine the behavior of the Potion's use(user,target) function.
    Usable  
    WeaponType
    Each Weapon object stores a reference to a WeaponType object, which it uses to determine its behavior on use(user,target).
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractItem
    This class provides basic implementation of the methods in the Item interface, primarily so that classes that wish to implement it don't have to write all of the implementation from scratch.
    Armor
    Currently half-implemented, Armor will be used in combat to determine how much damage a successful attack on its wearer does.
    Food  
    ItemBuilder
    This class is the only way to instantiate a new Item.
    Material
    This class is used for items used only for crafting/selling.
    Potion
    The Potion class is used for single-use, combat-usable items that apply some sort of effect to an entity.
    Weapon
    Items of this class can be equiped to an Entity's weapon slot, and delegate the use function to a WeaponType object.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    BasicItemType  
    BasicPotionType  
    BasicWeaponType  
    Rarity  
    UseTag
    Each object that implements the Useable interface has a UseTag.
    This tag is intended to be used by context-dependant parts of the program to determine if an item can, in fact, be used.
    Important: This tag does not prevent the use of an item by itself.
